title.rendered: Sinner becomes the youngest man to reach the Wimbledon semis in 16 years

content.rendered:
Jannik Sinner, world number eight, has become the youngest man in 16 years to reach the Wimbledon semi-finals.

Read Also: Mike Conley wins NBA’s sportsmanship award for record fourth time

The 21-year-old overcame Russia’s Roman Safiullin in the quarter-finals 6-4, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 to reach the Grand Slam semi-finals for the first time. Sinner won the game in two hours and fourteen minutes.
